title: Coronation Street SPOILER: Kym Marsh films wedding scene in plunging bridal gown (and trainers)
text:
She is soon set to depart her Corrie role as Michelle Connor after 13 years on the long-running ITV soap.

And, Kym Marsh, 43, donned a fairytale wedding dress, a veil and a pair of trainers as she filmed some of her final scenes for the soap in Manchester, which see her get hitched to her on-screen fiancé Robert Preston during a drama-fuelled day on the cobbles.

The actress looked sensational in the white, floorlength gown, which boasted a full skirt and plunging bodice, with a diamante waist band drawing attention to her trim figure.

SPOILER: Kym Marsh, 43, donned a fairytale wedding dress, a veil and a pair of trainers as she filmed her final Coronation Street scenes, which see her get hitched to fiancé Robert Preston

Despite it being Michelle's wedding day, is currently blissfully unaware that Robert, played by Tristan Gemmill, is leading a double life.

Her partner is also engaged to his secret lover Vicky Jefferies, who is pregnant with his baby.

Both women believe they are the only woman in Robert's life and he continues to lead his secret double life, splitting his time between the two women with each of them believing he is away on business when not with them.

Michelle’s ex-husband Steve McDonald, played by Simon Gregson, is among the guests at their special day, as well as her two sons – biological son Ali and mixed-up-at-birth son Ryan.

Gorgeous: The actress looked sensational in the white, floorlength gown, which boasted a full skirt and plunging bodice, with a diamante waist band drawing attention to her trim figure

What's going on? The actress looked sombre as she stood in her dress and trainers

Running off? The actress slipped into a pair of trainers during filming

Plus a whole host of Connors are in attendance, with Carla, played by Alison King, and Maria, played by Samia Longchambon, pictured on set during filming.

Viewers have seen Michelle planning the wedding blissfully unaware that Robert is also engaged to the mother of his unborn child, but will they tie the knot, or will she run off in her trainers?

The wedding scenes, filmed on location in Manchester will be on screens in December.

Spot the difference: For some scenes, Kym donned a pair of sparkling silver stilettos, while in others she sported the dark Nike trainers

Pensive: While in character, Kym looked pensive on the set of her soap wedding

Set to wed! The soap star beamed with delight as she fiddled with her sheer veil

Kooky: At one point, the radiant bride pulled a series of animated facial expressions

The former Hear'Say singer is leaving Coronation Street as she plans to spend more time with her hunky army beau, Scott Ratfliffe, 32, who's often on his base in the south of England.

Meanwhile, earlier this year, Kym stated that she dislikes her her partner being branded her 'toyboy', insisting that the term is 'insulting' to him.

Speaking in a candid chat to The Sun's Fabulous magazine, the star opened up about falling for Scott after previously stating that she was 'done' with men.

The couple were introduced by her co-star Anthony Cotton, with the pair building their relationship by talking for hours at a time via FaceTime and texting, before finally coming face-to-face three weeks later.

After revealing that she had already 'fallen' for him by the time they met, Kym said of Scott: 'Yeah, it’s love'. 'He has a smile that has the ability to light up any room. He’s got a lovely aura about him. People want to be around him. And I love that he’s not got any idea how fit he is.'

But with an 11-year age gap, the former Hear'Say singer addressed the inevitability of her partner being hailed as her 'toyboy'.

'It’s actually quite insulting to him,' she fumed. 'Because he’s a very intelligent, mature, articulate man who absolutely knows where he wants to be in life.'

Kym has been dating Scott since July last year, following her split from Matt Baker, who she had been dating for two years.

Wedding guests: A whole host of Connors are in attendance, with Maria, played by Samia Longchambon, pictured on set during filming alongside other on-screen family members

In good company: Alison King - who plays Carla Connor in the ITV soap - was also in attendance

Preparations: The thespian seemed to give Kym a prep-talk in between scenes

Cheery: James Burrows - who plays troubled doctor Ali Neeson - was in good spirits for the special occasion

Co-stars: Ryan Connor actor Ryan Prescott was pictured on set during a filming break (L) while a priest engaged in a phone conversation (R)

Giddy: The group opted for sophisticated appearances for the TV programme

The star was previously married to ex Hollyoaks favourite Jamie Lomas between 2012 and 2014.

Before that she was wed to former EastEnders star Jack Ryder, 37, between 2002 and 2009.

Addressing her failed romances, she shared: 'I’m a huge romantic but I’ve been unlucky in love. My mum and dad have been together since my mum was 18 and the problem with that is that me and my sister are always looking for my dad. And he doesn’t exist because, well, Dad’s Dad!'

Meanwhile, there was recent joy in the soap star's life when she became a grandmother for the first time after daughter Emilie gave birth to a baby boy called Teddy in May.
